meter

Class Meter

  • java.lang.Object
    • meter.Meter

  • public class Meter
extends java.lang.Object
    Display Arduino or other sensor readings in an analog meter. Defaults to an analog voltage meter of 0 - 5 volt range. A sensor reading is mapped to a meter value. Defaults to a half circle meter. The upper left corner of the meter is specified. The height is calculated as needed. An optional parameter specifies a full circle meter. Most of the meter parts can be changed by setting variables, use the GET methods to display default/current value of variables. Note: when changing the width value, do so immediately after instantiating a meter object. If changing the width in the Draw() loop, the old meter is not removed. Some methods will generate non-fatal warning messages depending upon what is changed first. May be used without microprocessor hardware to display software values.
    Author:
    Bill (Papa) Kujawa

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      • setMinScaleValue

        public void setMinScaleValue(float minValue)
        This is the minimum meter reading or value. For numeric scale labels, it would be the first value. This allows for non-numeric labels. It corresponds to the minInputSignal.

      • getMinScaleValue

        public float getMinScaleValue()

      • setMaxScaleValue

        public void setMaxScaleValue(float maxValue)
        This is the maximum meter reading or value. For numeric scale labels, it would be the last value. This allows for non-numeric labels. It corresponds to the maxInputSignal. As an example, a 0 - 255 microprocessor input signal is matched to a 0.0 - 5.0 meter value.

      • getMaxScaleValue

        public float getMaxScaleValue()

      • setArcColor

        public void setArcColor(int aColor)
        // The arc color when no low or high warnings are enabled // Note: will be changed to the midSensorWarningArcColor.

      • getArcColor

        public int getArcColor()

      • setDisplayArc

        public void setDisplayArc(boolean displayArc)
        Allows the removal of the arc from the meter. Note: the arc would be the mirror on a real analog meter. It was used to align the needle with your eye to ensure a correct reading.
        Parameters:
        displayArc -

      • getDisplayArc

        public boolean getDisplayArc()

      • setArcThickness

        public void setArcThickness(int thick)

      • getArcThickness

        public int getArcThickness()

      • setArcMinDegrees

        public void setArcMinDegrees(double minDegrees)
        Determines where the meter arc starts. 0.0 degrees is at 3:00 o'clock and moves clockwise The default arc is 180.0 degrees at 9:00 o'clock to 360.0 degrees at 3:00 o'clock. Note: use a full circle meter for arc starts less than 180.0 degrees.
        Parameters:
        minDegrees -

      • getArcMinDegrees

        public double getArcMinDegrees()

      • setArcMaxDegrees

        public void setArcMaxDegrees(double maxDegrees)
        Determines where the meter arc ends. 360.0 degrees is at 3:00 o'clock. Use a full circle meter if using a larger value.
        Parameters:
        maxDegrees -

      • getArcMaxDegrees

        public double getArcMaxDegrees()

      • setScaleFontColor

        public void setScaleFontColor(int sColor)

      • getScaleFontColor

        public int getScaleFontColor()

      • setScaleLabels

        public void setScaleLabels(java.lang.String[] labels)
        Each label will coincide with a long tic mark. The minimumMeterValue and maximumMeterValue are used to calculate the tic spacing. This allows for non-numeric scale labels. Note: for a full circle meter with 360 degree labels, include the last label even if it would overlap the first label. In that case set displayLastScaleLabel to false. The number of labels determines the correct spacing.
        Parameters:
        labels -

      • getScaleLabels

        public java.lang.String[] getScaleLabels()

      • setScaleOffsetFromPivotPoint

        public void setScaleOffsetFromPivotPoint(int scaleOffset)
        The arc length of the scale labels from the pivot point.
        Parameters:
        scaleOffset -

      • getScaleOffsetFromPivotPoint

        public int getScaleOffsetFromPivotPoint()

      • setDisplayLastScaleLabel

        public void setDisplayLastScaleLabel(boolean displayLastLabel)
        Disable the display of the last scale label for a full circle meter. This prevents the last label from overwriting the first one.
        Parameters:
        displayLastLabel -

      • getDisplayLastScaleLabel

        public boolean getDisplayLastScaleLabel()
